posts.post_content: I made a really good 4 color deck with this and cascade. I was able to get 44 life. Kill 8 of my opponent's creatures, and have 4x +4/+0 [Enlisted Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enlisted Wurm). 4x +4/+0 [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf), 4x +4/+0 [Kitchen Finks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kitchen Finks), 4x +4/+0 [Murderous Redcap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murderous Redcap), and 4x +4/+0 [Boggart Ram-Gang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Ram-Gang) all on turn 6.

posts.post_content:
OK, so this and Relentless Rats is a given.  
  
But it goes oh so lovely with [Door of Destinies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Door of Destinies), since you still cast the card.  
  
So now, when you get 30 rats out with this, they're not 31/31s. They're 61/61s.  
  
Tasty.

Posted By: JenBroness (7/23/2010 8:38:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The best way to use is with Beacons. Like [Beacon of Unrest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beacon of Unrest) (which could also return the Thrumming stone back to play in case it gets destroyed) or [Beacon of Destruction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beacon of Destruction). Then you should thin your library as quickly as possible. The fewer cards there left, the higher the chance the beacons will turn up.  
  
I got a blue-black deck around that, using hand disruption and bounce to buy time, and many small cantrips and card drawers to thin the library. Since they ripple as well, this works very quickly. No tournament deck, but still fun.
posts.html:
The best way to use is with Beacons. Like Beacon of Unrest (which could also return the Thrumming stone back to play in case it gets destroyed) or Beacon of Destruction. Then you should thin your library as quickly as possible. The fewer cards there left, the higher the chance the beacons will turn up.

I got a blue-black deck around that, using hand disruption and bounce to buy time, and many small cantrips and card drawers to thin the library. Since they ripple as well, this works very quickly. No tournament deck, but still fun.
